intro: Cyphostigma longitubum, commonly known as the long-tubed cyphostigma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, often with a hairy texture. Cyphostigma longitubum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
